onset.Description: Marks the start of an ongoing event of temporal extent.

duration.LongName: The period of time during which an event occurs.
duration.Description: Refers to duration of cue presentation or response time towards target item. (a) For valid_cue and invalid_cue, duration refers to the image presentation of cue. (b) For target_response, duration refers to response time to respond to target item. It is calculated as the interval between onset of button press and onset of target presentation

run_type.LongName: The type of subtasks within task-social
run_type.Description: Refers to the type of subtask: [pain, vicarious, cognitive']

Levels.pain: The stimuli being delivered is thermal heat.
Levels.vicarious: The stimuli being delivered is a video with patients in pain
Levels.cognitive: The stimuli being delivered is an image with two figures; participants are prompted to mentally rotate the figures and decide whether they are same or different

trial_type.LongName: Type of epochs with each trial
trial_type.Description: There are four epochs in each trial: cue, expectrating, stim, outcomerating

Levels.cue: Participants passively viewed a presentation of a high or low social cue, consisting of data points that participants believed indicated other people's ratings for that stimulus presented for 1 second on screen
Levels.expectrating: Participants provided ratings of their expectations on the upcoming stimulus intensity on a gLMS scale for a total duration of 4 seconds overlaid with the cue image
Levels.stim: Participants passively received/viewed experimentally delivered stimuli for each of the mental rotation, vicarious pain, and somatic pain tasks for 5 seconds each
Levels.outcomerating: Participants provided ratings on their subjective experience of cognitive effort, vicarious pain, or somatic pain for 4 seconds

trial_index.Description: Indicates the trial order. There are a total of 12 trials in each run.

cue.LongName: A cue to indicate level of upcoming stimulus intensity
cue.Description: Participants passively viewed a presentation of a high or low social cue, consisting of data points that participants believed indicated other people's ratings for that stimulus presented for 1 second on screen

Levels.high_cue: Data points on the cue indicate that past participants perceived the upcoming stimulus as having high intensity
Levels.low_cue: Data points on the cue indicate that past participants perceived the upcoming stimulus as having low intensity

Levels.high_stim: High intensity stimulus (pain, vicarious, cognitive task)
Levels.med_stim: Medium intensity stimulus (pain, vicarious, cognitive task)
Levels.low_stim: Low intensity stimulus (pain, vicarious, cognitive task)

rating_value.Description: The rating degree on a semicircle scale

rating_glmslabel.LongName: Labels of generalized Labeled Magnitude Scale (gLMS)
rating_glmslabel.Description: Labels of generalized Labeled Magnitude Scale (gLMS)

rating_value_fillna.LongName: Rating value with imputed values from mouse trajectory data
rating_value_fillna.Description: Using mouse trajectory data, we extract the last degree recorded on the scale. From this, we impute degrees for cells that were originally marked n/a

rating_glmslabel_fillna.LongName: Labels of generalized Labeled Magnitude Scale (gLMS)
rating_glmslabel_fillna.Description: Labels of generalized Labeled Magnitude Scale (gLMS)

rating_mouseonset.Description: the time when the participant started moving the trackball in relation to the rating epoch

rating_mousedur.LongName: The period of time during which an event occurs.
rating_mousedur.Description: Refers to duration of cue presentation or response time towards target item. (a) For valid_cue and invalid_cue, duration refers to the image presentation of cue. (b) For target_response, duration refers to response time to respond to target item. It is calculated as the interval between onset of button press and onset of target presentation

stim_file.Description: Represents the location of the stimulus file (such as an image, video, or audio file) presented at the given onset time.

pain_onset_ttl1.LongName: Onset time of pain stimulus (ramp up)
pain_onset_ttl1.Description: Marks the start of an pain stimulus trigger.

pain_onset_ttl2.LongName: Onset time of pain stimulus (reach plateau)
pain_onset_ttl2.Description: Marks the start of when pain stimulus reaches intended temperature and starts plateau.

pain_onset_ttl3.LongName: Onset time of pain stimulus (ramp down)
pain_onset_ttl3.Description: Marks the end of an pain plateau.

pain_onset_ttl4.Description: Marks the end of a pain stimulus trigger, returning to baseline.

pain_stimulus_delivery_success.Description: Marks the end of a pain stimulus trigger, returning to baseline.

cognitive_correct_response.LongName: Correct response for the rotated image
cognitive_correct_response.Description: Correct answer for whether two figures are same or different

Levels.same: The two figures are the same

cognitive_participant_response.LongName: Participant response for the rotated image
cognitive_participant_response.Description: Participant respond to two options -- same or diff -- to the two figures on screen

Levels.same: The two figures are the same

cognitive_response_accuracy.Description: Marks the end of a pain stimulus trigger, returning to baseline.

Levels.True: Correct response in regards to image (correctly identified as old or new)
Levels.False: Incorrect response in regards to image (incorrectly identified as old or new)
